newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's finance minister quits in forex row.
newsitem.headline: Israel's finance minister quits in forex row.

text.p: Israeli Finance Minister Dan Meridor resigned on Wednesday after an emergency cabinet meeting failed to resolve a dispute over foreign currency reforms he opposed, a Treasury spokesman said.
"Finance Minister Meridor has resigned," the spokesman said.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had convened the cabinet to present a compromise in a dispute over widening the exchange rate band.
Meridor strongly opposed the widening the band, saying it would cause an appreciation of the Israeli currency.
But Israeli Army Radio said at the end of the seven-hour cabinet meeting that ministers voted eight to three in favour of Netanyahu's proposal to widen the band.
Some Israeli political commentators said Netanyahu had forced a showdown with Meridor over the issue in order to squeeze his long-time Likud party rival out of the government.
